input.label: ENUMERATOR: Ask to interview the head of the target household and any other members of the household who are involved with agriculture in the household.

ENUMERATOR: If different household members are responsible for different parts of the households agricultural production, ask that all of these different members be called to participate in the survey.
Hello. How are you? My name is (name) and I am working with some researchers from Innovation for Poverty Action (IPA), a research organization based in USA.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: We are currently carrying out a research project to learn more about the use of rice varieties and we would like to know about your rice production and harvest and your households general well being. We have one short questionnaire that collects all this information, which we expect should take about 90 minutes of your time.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: There is no direct benefit to participating in this survey. Your participation would help this research collect information to learn exactly how the use of different rice seed improve can yields.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: There are no foreseeable risks to you or your family if you participate in this study. However, you do not need to talk to me if you do not want to. And if there is any question you do not want to answer, that will be fine.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: If you do want to talk with me, I will keep everything that you tell me entirely private and confidential, and will not talk to other people about what you have said. I will also keep you and your familys names confidential, as well as those of your social network, and not tell anyone that you have talked to me.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: At the office, we will separate identifying information such as your name and location of your house from your answers to the survey question, and keep these in a safe, separate, file. We will keep this information stored, also after the study is finished, since we may want to follow-up in the future.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: Your answers will in no way affect the assistance that may be provided to your community or your family. Participation in this project is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

input.label: You may discontinue your participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled. If you have any problems, or if you feel uncomfortable answering any question, you should feel free to stop talking with me at any time, and you can speak with people in the main office.
input.hint: Please read this note to Respondents

FARM PICTURE (FOR DETAILED GUIDANCE PLEASE REFER TO THE MANUAL)
Have a marker and the farm picture sheet for this household ready.
Make the respondent(s) aware that they will be trying a new and interesting exercise.
After demonstrating how they can easily delete anything drawn using the tissue, hand them the marker and ask them to draw all of their farms WHERE RICE IS GROWN.
All we need is a very basic representation of all the farms the household has cultivated rice in the past 12 months and ideally, but not essentially, their relative sizes.
Note that the farm picture is not a map and should not represent farm locations and routes to them.
Specifically ask whether any of these farms had any amount of NERICA cultivated on them.
If there is a plot where NERICA is grown, that plot should be recorded as a separate farm and numbered Farm 1.
Any additional plots with NERICA should immediately follow as farm 2 etc
After all NERICA farms are recorded, number the remaining farms.

select1.label: ENUMERATOR: Has the respondent represented all of the farms?

input.label: Please complete the farm pictures before moving forward
Once the interviewee has produced a representation of all the hh farms (double check that the farm picture is complete), you should:
Enter into these circles the ecology, the name of the HH member responsible for the farm, and the names (and preferably some pictures) of the main crops cultivated on each farm
Erase farms that do not contain rice
Clearly number the farms that contain rice. As you give each farm a number (entering it into the circle), speak out the farm number, and make sure that the interviewee is following along.
Begin the farm data collection, but keep the map because you will use it for the rest of the survey
ENUMERATOR: On how many farms did the household cultivate rice in the past 12 months
For each farm where rice was cultivated during the 2012 season, please answer the following questions.

Start with one farm until you have answered all question. At the end of this section, the PDA will ask you if you want to add another group member. Say YES if more farms to add. Say NO if you have added all farms
